meanings.sent1: The messy room was so disorderly that you couldn't find anything.
meanings.sent2: The teacher scolded the students for their disorderly desks.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's disorderly collection of nuts made the other animals laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like a disorderly jumble of tangled yarn.
meanings.sent5: The artist's palette was a disorderly mix of vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: Characterized by unruly or disruptive behavior
meanings.sent1: The disorderly crowd at the concert pushed and shoved to get closer to the stage.
meanings.sent2: The disorderly conduct of the children at the party led to chaos.
meanings.sent3: The disorderly puppies ran around the house, knocking over everything in their path.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a disorderly storm of conflicting emotions.
meanings.sent5: The wind created a disorderly dance of leaves in the yard.

meanings.definition: Not functioning in an orderly way
meanings.sent1: The disorderly computer system kept crashing during the presentation.
meanings.sent2: The disorderly traffic caused long delays on the highway.
meanings.sent3: The disorderly alarm clock refused to ring at the right time.
meanings.sent4: Her schedule was so disorderly that she missed important appointments.
meanings.sent5: The old machine made a disorderly clanking noise when turned on.
